intro: Hieracium leptophyton subsp. anocladum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single flower. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and disturbed soils, preferring temperate climates. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters. This subspecies is distinguished by its shorter stems and reduced leaf structure compared to other members of the Hieracium genus.
